page.title: 17News and information.
page.content: {The Villager} is produced every two months, and is delivered free to every home in Brightwell cum Sotwell. The magazine is edited by Mr. F. Heyworth. The magazine is produced by a voluntary group and paid for by advertiseing by local traders. About 600 copies are produced for each issue. Wallingford has its own community news sheet. The {Wallingford Herald} is the main local newspaper printed weekly in Oxford. It is part of a series of Herald papers. Its companion paper is the daily {Oxford Mail.} Local papers are also published in Reading. There are also a number of free papers delivered in the village. {Radio Oxford} and {Radio 210} are the main local Radio stations. Radio Oxford is run by the BBC and 210 is an independant IBA station.
